item.title: Hydraulic Quantity Indications – Hydraulic Temperature Indication Operative

numlitem.para: Associated reservoir level is verified normal before each departure,
Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated hydraulic temperature indication is verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "___ HYD QTY IND INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Before each departure, check reservoir level for proper fluid quantity using the fill indicator at the fill station.

A sight gauge installed on each reservoir may be used to check the reservoir fluid level if the EICAS or fill station indication(s) is inoperative. Fill or drain reservoir as required (AMM 12-12-01) to ensure that fluid level is in upper half of the sight gauge.

note.para: To prevent incorrect quantity display due to inoperative indications, the appropriate Hydraulic Quantity Transmitter Connectors (DT401, DT402, DT403, or DT404) may be disconnected, capped and stowed.

numlitem.para: Required indications for the associated system are verified as follows:
Push the HYD switch on the EICAS Display Select Panel. The Hydraulic Synoptic Page will come into view on the Auxiliary EICAS screen.
Verify the associate SYS FAULT light is ON before the system is pressurized.
Pressurize the associated system and verify the following indications on the Hydraulic Synoptic Page:
Verify hydraulic fluid temperature is less than 80°C.
